item.title: R & Python Rosetta Stone: EDA with dplyr vs pandas
item.description: This is the first post in a new series featuring translations between R and Python code for common data science and machine learning tasks. A Rosetta Stone, if you will. I’m writing this mainly as a documented cheat sheet for myself, as I’m frequently switching between the two languages. Personally, I have learned Python and R around the same time, several years ago, but tidy R is much more intuitive to me than any other language.
